ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How has your motivation / interest / enthusiasm been over the past month?
Notes: 1=Greater than Normal; 2=Normal; 3=Minimally Diminished; 4=Moderately Diminished; 5=Markedly Diminished; 6=Totally Absent

ElementDescription: How has your wakefulness / alertness been over the past month?
Notes: 1=Greater than Normal; 2=Normal; 3=Minimally Diminished; 4=Moderately Diminished; 5=Markedly Diminished; 6=Totally Absent

ElementDescription: How has your energy been over the past month?
Notes: 1=Greater than Normal; 2=Normal; 3=Minimally Diminished; 4=Moderately Diminished; 5=Markedly Diminished; 6=Totally Absent

ElementDescription: How has your ability to focus / sustain attention been over the past month?

ElementDescription: How has your ability to remember / recall information been over the past month?
Notes: 1=Greater than Normal; 2=Normal; 3=Minimally Diminished; 4=Moderately Diminished; 5=Markedly Diminished; 6=Totally Absent

ElementDescription: How has your ability to find words been over the past month?
Notes: 1=Greater than Normal; 2=Normal; 3=Minimally Diminished; 4=Moderately Diminished; 5=Markedly Diminished; 6=Totally Absent

ElementDescription: How has your sharpness / mental acuity been over the past month?
Notes: 1=Greater than Normal; 2=Normal; 3=Minimally Diminished; 4=Moderately Diminished; 5=Markedly Diminished; 6=Totally Absent
System variable: unique code for each type of visit -use to merge files
